snippet: A dedication ceremony, which ended with a speech by President Obama, took the audience back through 48 years of history, to 1963 and a defining moment for the civil rights movement, when Dr. King led the March on Washington and gave his “I Have a...
lead_paragraph: A dedication ceremony, which ended with a speech by President Obama, took the audience back through 48 years of history, to 1963 and a defining moment for the civil rights movement, when Dr. King led the March on Washington and gave his “I Have a Dream” speech on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial.

headline.main: Dedication of the Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial
